TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit WSTrustMessage extends System.IdentityModel.OpenObject
Public MustInherit Class WSTrustMessage Inherits OpenObject
public ref class WSTrustMessage abstract : System::IdentityModel::OpenObject

Docs.summary: The Base class for RST and RSTR.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about the message and elements that this class represents, see the version of the WS-Trust specification that applies to your scenario.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default constructor for extensibility.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowPostdating { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AllowPostdating : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the contents of the wst:AllowPostdating element.
Docs.value: if returned tokens should allow requests for postdated tokens; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This optional element indicates that returned tokens should allow requests for postdated tokens.
This property is usually used with the token renewal binding.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::IdentityModel::Protocols::WSTrust::EndpointReference ^ AppliesTo { System::IdentityModel::Protocols::WSTrust::EndpointReference ^ get(); void set(System::IdentityModel::Protocols::WSTrust::EndpointReference ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the contents of the wsp:AppliesTo element.
Docs.value: An that represents the endpoint address for which the security token is desired.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This optional element specifies the endpoint address for which this security token is desired; for example, the service to which the token applies.
Either wst:TokenType or wst:AppliesTo should be defined in the token request message. If both are specified, the wst:AppliesTo field takes precedence.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ AuthenticationType { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.AuthenticationType : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the contents of the wst:AuthenticationType element.
Docs.value: A string that contains a URI that indicates the type of authentication desired.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This optional element indicates the type of authentication desired, specified as a URI.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::IdentityModel::Protocols::WSTrust::BinaryExchange ^ BinaryExchange { System::IdentityModel::Protocols::WSTrust::BinaryExchange ^ get(); void set(System::IdentityModel::Protocols::WSTrust::BinaryExchange ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the contents of the wst:BinaryExchange element.
Docs.value: A that contains the binary data exchanged. This includes the contents of the ValueType and EncodingType attributes as well as the actual data.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ CanonicalizationAlgorithm { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.CanonicalizationAlgorithm : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the contents of the wst:CanonicalizationAlgorithm element.
Docs.value: A string that contains a URI that indicates the canonicalization algorithm.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Context { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Context : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the contents of the Context attribute on the RST or RSTR.
Docs.value: A string that contains a URI that identifies the context of a request or response message.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The optional Context attribute on an RST element specifies an identifier (context) for a request. All subsequent RSTR elements relating to this request must carry this attribute.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ EncryptionAlgorithm { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.EncryptionAlgorithm : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the contents of the wst:EncryptionAlgorithm element.
Docs.value: A string that contains a URI that indicates the encryption algorithm.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This optional URI element indicates the desired encryption algorithm used within the returned token.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ EncryptWith { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.EncryptWith : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the contents of the wst:EncryptWith element.
Docs.value: A string that contains a URI that indicates the desired encryption algorithm to be used with the issued security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This optional URI element indicates the desired encryption algorithm to be used with the issued security token.

Docs.exception: An attempt to set the property to or an empty string occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::IdentityModel::Protocols::WSTrust::Entropy ^ Entropy { System::IdentityModel::Protocols::WSTrust::Entropy ^ get(); void set(System::IdentityModel::Protocols::WSTrust::Entropy ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the contents of the wst:Entropy element.
Docs.value: A that represents the contents of the entropy element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This optional element allows a requestor to specify entropy that is to be used in creating the key. This is commonly used in a token issuance request message. The value of this element should be either an EncryptedKey or BinarySecret depending on whether or not the key is encrypted.

member this.KeySizeInBits : Nullable<int> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the contents of the wst:KeySize element inside a RequestSecurityToken (RST) message.
Docs.exception: An attempt to set a value less than or equal to zero occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ KeyType { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.KeyType : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the contents of the wst:KeyType element inside a RequestSecurityToken (RST) message.
Docs.value: A string that contains the URI that identifies the type of key desired.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This optional URI element indicates the type of key desired in the security token.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ KeyWrapAlgorithm { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.KeyWrapAlgorithm : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the contents of the wst:KeyWrapAlgorithm element.
Docs.value: A string that contains the URI that identifies the key wrap algorithm.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This optional URI indicates the desired algorithm to use for key wrapping when STS encrypts the issued token for the relying party using an asymmetric key.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::IdentityModel::Protocols::WSTrust::Lifetime ^ Lifetime { System::IdentityModel::Protocols::WSTrust::Lifetime ^ get(); void set(System::IdentityModel::Protocols::WSTrust::Lifetime ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the contents of the wst:Lifetime element inside a RequestSecurityToken (RST) message.
Docs.value: A that represents the desired time during which the returned token will be valid.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This optional element specifies the desired time range during which the returned security token is valid.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ ReplyTo { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.ReplyTo : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the address to be used for replying to the Relying Party.
Docs.value: A string that contains the address.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is a local extension that is used exclusively in passive scenarios with the WS-Federation protocol.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ RequestType { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.RequestType : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the wst:RequestType element.
Docs.value: A string that contains a URI that indicates the request type; for example, one of the constants defined in the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This required element indicates the request type.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ SignatureAlgorithm { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.SignatureAlgorithm : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the contents of the wst:SignatureAlgorithm element.
Docs.value: A string that contains a URI that indicates the signature algorithm.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This optional URI element indicates the desired signature algorithm used within the returned token.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ SignWith { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.SignWith : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the contents of the wst:SignWith element.
Docs.value: A string that contains a URI that identifies the desired signature algorithm.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This optional URI element indicates the desired signature algorithm to be used with the issued security token. This is an extension to the RequestSecurityToken element.

Docs.exception: An attempt to set the value to or an empty string occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ TokenType { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.TokenType : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the contents of the wst:TokenType element.
Docs.value: A string that contains a URI that indicates the token type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This optional element indicates the desired token type.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::IdentityModel::Protocols::WSTrust::UseKey ^ UseKey { System::IdentityModel::Protocols::WSTrust::UseKey ^ get(); void set(System::IdentityModel::Protocols::WSTrust::UseKey ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the contents of the wst:UseKey element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the requestor wishes to use an existing key rather than create a new one, then this property can be used to reference a security token containing the desired key. This is commonly used in the asymmetric key issuance case.
